moves.1. e4 e5 2. Nf3 f6 3. Nc3 c6 4. Bc4 b5 5: It's clear at this point Black is trying to do all of his work with the pawns. I can't figure out why none of his pieces are still on the bench.
moves.5... a5: Black has just about taken away all the safe spaces for my bishop to go.
moves.6. a4 b4 7. Ne2: Only safe place for the knight to go.
moves.7... h5 8. d4 exd4 9. Nexd4: Now I have a half-open file to his king.
moves.9... c5 10. Nf5 Ne7: It is here where Black kills himself. He cuts off a potential escape square for his own king, and most devastatingly, cuts off the bishop's protection of d6.
moves.11. Nd6#: Smothered mate. I hope this guy learns how important it is to get his minor pieces into the game quickly.
